body:
This is most likely a consequence of https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/62df880d673c4da582f855e261cf68735ef9c051 combined with this handling of `InterruptedException` in this case:
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/3e1ce3346287f20f53ffc63d9c7dfcc508cb6e20/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/dynamic/DynamicSpawnStrategy.java#L604-L618

The messages at the top make it seem like their local branches won and cancelled the remote branches, which results in an `InterruptedException` wrapped in an `ExecutionException` since https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/62df880d673c4da582f855e261cf68735ef9c051. Catching `CancellationException` was necessary to avoid this crash:
```
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.CancellationException: Task was cancelled.
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.cancellationExceptionWithCause(AbstractFuture.java:1021)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.getDoneValue(AbstractFuture.java:288)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFutureState.blockingGet(AbstractFutureState.java:255)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.Platform.get(Platform.java:54)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.get(AbstractFuture.java:253)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.FluentFuture$TrustedFuture.get(FluentFuture.java:91)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.merkletree.MerkleTreeComputer.getFromFuture(MerkleTreeComputer.java:929)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.merkletree.MerkleTreeComputer.buildForSpawn(MerkleTreeComputer.java:309)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.RemoteExecutionService.uploadInputsIfNotPresent(RemoteExecutionService.java:1867)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.RemoteSpawnRunner.lambda$exec$1(RemoteSpawnRunner.java:280)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.Retrier.execute(Retrier.java:268)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.RemoteRetrier.execute(RemoteRetrier.java:111)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.RemoteSpawnRunner.exec(RemoteSpawnRunner.java:271)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.exec.AbstractSpawnStrategy.exec(AbstractSpawnStrategy.java:148)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.dynamic.RemoteBranch.runRemotely(RemoteBranch.java:89)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.dynamic.DynamicSpawnStrategy.maybeExecuteNonDynamically(DynamicSpawnStrategy.java:432)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.dynamic.DynamicSpawnStrategy.exec(DynamicSpawnStrategy.java:207)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.exec.SpawnStrategyResolver.exec(SpawnStrategyResolver.java:46)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.analysis.actions.SpawnAction.execute(SpawnAction.java:282)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor$ActionRunner.executeAction(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:1237)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor$ActionRunner.run(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:1142)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionState.runStateMachine(ActionExecutionState.java:166)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionState.getResultOrDependOnFuture(ActionExecutionState.java:95)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor.executeAction(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:653)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.checkCacheAndExecuteIfNeeded(ActionExecutionFunction.java:780)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.computeInternal(ActionExecutionFunction.java:345)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.compute(ActionExecutionFunction.java:202)
        at com.google.devtools.build.skyframe.AbstractParallelEvaluator$Evaluate.run(AbstractParallelEvaluator.java:471)
        ... 8 more
```

The remote branch would then be considered `not cancelled and done`, which matches the exception below. But for this to actually crash the local branch would also need to be cancelled and I'm not yet sure how that can happen.

@keith Does this happen before https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/62df880d673c4da582f855e261cf68735ef9c051 (both the crash an the extra log messages that precede it)? How often do you see this? And did you interrupt this build?

body:
I didn't interrupt this build, it actually crashed on its own.

I do believe 62df880d673c4da582f855e261cf68735ef9c051 is the culprit as it shows constantly if I build on that commit, but I didn't see it testing a single build on 348df6b32efdc57c2001e40bd2ce713b60bf2a98

another trace from testing this just now:

```
INFO: Caught InterruptedException from ExecutionException for remote branch of KGEN/include/KGEN/POPDialect/POPDialect.md, which may cause a crash.
INFO: Caught InterruptedException from ExecutionException for remote branch of KGEN/include/KGEN/LITDialect/LITEnums.cpp.inc, which may cause a crash.
INFO: Caught InterruptedException from ExecutionException for remote branch of KGEN/include/KGEN/POPDialect/POPDialect.cpp.inc, which may cause a crash.
INFO: Caught InterruptedException from ExecutionException for remote branch of KGEN/include/KGEN/KGENDialect/KGENTypeInterfaces.cpp.inc, which may cause a crash.
Analyzing: 1944 targets (454 packages loaded, 84380 targets and 10289 aspects configured)
[10,105 / 26,572] 125 / 1048 tests; 2 actions, 0 running; last test: //Support/tools/driver-tblgen:driver-tblgen_GenManPage.cpp.tidy
    TdGenerate external/+llvm_configure+llvm-project/mlir/include/mlir/Dialect/Shape/IR/ShapeOpsDialect.h.inc; 2s remote, disk-cache
    TdGenerate external/+llvm_configure+llvm-project/mlir/include/mlir/Dialect/ArmSME/IR/ArmSMEOps.cpp.inc; 2s remote, disk-cache
FATAL: bazel crashed due to an internal error. Printing stack trace:
java.lang.AssertionError: Neither branch of KGEN/include/KGEN/LITDialect/LITEnums.cpp.inc completed. Local was cancelled and done and remote was not cancelled and done.
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.dynamic.DynamicSpawnStrategy.waitBranches(DynamicSpawnStrategy.java:555)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.dynamic.DynamicSpawnStrategy.exec(DynamicSpawnStrategy.java:244)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.exec.SpawnStrategyResolver.exec(SpawnStrategyResolver.java:46)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.analysis.actions.SpawnAction.execute(SpawnAction.java:282)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor$ActionRunner.executeAction(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:1236)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor$ActionRunner.run(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:1141)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionState.runStateMachine(ActionExecutionState.java:166)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionState.getResultOrDependOnFuture(ActionExecutionState.java:95)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeActionExecutor.executeAction(SkyframeActionExecutor.java:652)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.checkCacheAndExecuteIfNeeded(ActionExecutionFunction.java:780)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.computeInternal(ActionExecutionFunction.java:345)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.ActionExecutionFunction.compute(ActionExecutionFunction.java:202)
        at com.google.devtools.build.skyframe.AbstractParallelEvaluator$Evaluate.run(AbstractParallelEvaluator.java:471)
        at com.google.devtools.build.lib.concurrent.AbstractQueueVisitor$WrappedRunnable.run(AbstractQueueVisitor.java:435)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask$RunnableExecuteAction.compute(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask$RunnableExecuteAction.compute(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask$InterruptibleTask.exec(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.topLevelExec(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(Unknown Source)
```
